titles.title: Cut Profits to the Cuban Regime Act of 2020
Cut Profits to the Cuban Regime Act of 2020

A bill to require the Department of State to publish a list of countries that contract with the Government of Cuba for their medical missions program and ensure that such contracts are considered as factors in considering Trafficking in Persons report rankings, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

bill.summary:
Cut Profits to the Cuban Regime Act of 2020
This bill requires the Department of State to publish a list of countries that contract with Cuba's medical missions program and to consider, when determining a country's ranking for the annual Trafficking in Persons (TIP) Report, whether the country participated in programs with foreign organizations that enable human trafficking.
Cuba's overseas medical missions program employs health care professionals in more than 60 countries but has been included in the annual TIP Report for indicators of human trafficking in the program.
